description: Add integration/unit tests that exercise multiple concurrent clients and validate correct isolation, ordering, and throughput. Include regression test for the previously failing scenario.

title: Implement multi-client parallel streaming support
description: Use research findings to enable multiple concurrent clients on one server instance. Ensure session allocation and engine concurrency are correct; handle backpressure and per-session isolation.

title: Fix Linux sentencepiece build config
description: Static sentencepiece build fails on Linux (missing uint32_t). Switch to system sentencepiece or otherwise resolve build errors.

title: Add JSON schema for config.toml with proper schema reference
description:
Create a JSON schema for the eaRS config.toml file and add the schema reference.

## What to create:

### 1. Create `examples/config.schema.json`
- Define schema for all config sections: storage, model, whisper, server, dictation, hotkeys, subs
- Include proper types, descriptions, defaults, and enums where applicable
- Use JSON Schema draft-07 format

### 2. Move config file
- Move `config/config.toml` to `examples/config.toml` (standard location for byteowlz projects)

### 3. Add schema reference to config.toml
At the top of the config file, add:
```toml
"\$schema" = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/byteowlz/schemas/refs/heads/main/eaRS/eaRS.config.schema.json"
```

### 4. Sync schema to central repo
After creating the schema, run:
```bash
byt schema sync --push
```

This will copy the schema to the byteowlz/schemas repo and push it.

## Reference
See other byteowlz repos like mmry, byt, or pipr for examples of config.schema.json files.
